poemName: Almost as stone as a rock
poemContent: Es ist schwierig,sehr schweirig wie ein Stein,As the walls fall in, and he crumbles into stone,in the place of his heart: brick,and his mind: rock,And as he starts to decompose,Er hat sehr dick bekommen,und ist jetzt tot.OzyAndy weathering at his craggy throne,by the playground the seagulls sing,"OzyAndy, King of Kings",Stone crumbles to rock, androck crumbles to dust,Mother nature cherishes, and licks with age,Father nature knows, he must do what he must,Now only a gargoyle, on the lone rockat land's end,"Hier liegt ozy-andy"haben sie gelesen.
